reasoning: Peripheral T-cell lymphoma accounts for 5-15% of non-Hodgkin lymphomas. US SEER data (2011-2012) shows age-standardized incidence rate of 2.1 per 100,000. Male predominance (M:F ratio 1.8) and higher in Black populations. Incidence increased 280% from 1992-2005. Geographic variation: Beijing 0.35, Korea 0.82, UK 0.92 per 100k.
source: Racial Patterns of Peripheral T-Cell Lymphoma Incidence and Survival in the United States - PMC5070555; SEER surveillance data 2011-2012
